article.headline: Liberty 71, Char. Southern 67 (OT)
article.story: LYNCHBURG, Va. (AP) -- Larry Blair scored 14 points and made two of Liberty's four free throws in the final 1:22 of overtime Monday night as the Flames beat Charleston Southern 71-67, keeping the Buccaneers winless in the Big South. Liberty (12-12, 9-3 Big South) broke the second tie of overtime when Jason Sarchet hit 1 of 2 from the line with 1:22 left, gained a 3-point lead on Blair's free throws with 50 seconds to play and sealed it on Gabe Martin's free throw with :18 left. Charleston Southern (3-19, 0-11), which forced overtime on Trent Drafts' layup with 1:06 left in regulation, didn't score for the final 2:37 of overtime after a three-point play by Ed O'Neil gave them a 67-65 lead. Sarchet added 13 points, David Dees 11 and Ryan Mantlo 10 for Liberty, which outscored the Bucs 15-6 from the foul line and outrebounded them 46-32. Kurtis Rice led Charleston Southern with 18 points and O'Neil had 12 and eight assists, but missed 12 of his 16 shots from the field.
